body.p:
Tompkinsville Ky.
July 10/63
To His Excellency
Gov. Robinson

Do me the favor to appoint me a Notary Public for Monroe County Kentucky. A Notary is absolutely necessary in this county to save widows, orphans &C heavy expense & trouble in fixing up their claims against the Government, and as I know of no one else who has applied I hope I may get
the appointment.
I refer to any one in this part of the country who may be known to your Excellency for proof of my loyalty & capacity for the place I seek.

I have the honor to be Your obt. Servt
John W. Counts

Monroe Co
Notary
Jno. W. Counts
Issd July 18. 1863

Make apptmt and send as requested.
J F Robinson
